meanings.definition: To compress excessively or beyond the necessary or desired level.
meanings.sent1: She kept overcompressing the clothes in the suitcase, making it difficult to close.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overcompressing the soil when planting flowers, which can harm the roots.
meanings.sent3: The chef's overcompressing of the dough resulted in a flat and dense cake.
meanings.sent4: His habit of overcompressing his schedule left him feeling stressed and overwhelmed.
meanings.sent5: Overcompressing the clay in pottery class made it lose its natural texture and shape.

meanings.definition: The act of applying too much pressure or force to compress something.
meanings.sent1: The overcompressing of the spring caused it to lose its elasticity.
meanings.sent2: She noticed the overcompressing of the packaging when the box arrived crushed.
meanings.sent3: The overcompressing of the balloon made it burst with a loud pop.
meanings.sent4: The overcompressing of the trash in the bin made it difficult to close the lid.
meanings.sent5: His overcompressing of the sponge squeezed out all the water, leaving it dry and hard.
